Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just a plot of the raw data, the orange is 51% correlated data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: randomly selected within past day, so can be any price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ignore green line, it is supposed to be smooth, but bugs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is first time i see the greenline

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @TonyL i made new version (still in jl777) plz update so I can see the (hopefully) better data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @SHossain the problem is that the trustless oracles allow anybody to mine a block and as long as it is within 1% of previous block and a nodes local data, it is accepted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still it is possible for a miner to consistently bias the price by up to 1%, maybe a bit more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if we are allowing leverage even a 0.5% biasing of price will skew the results of a 100x leveraged bet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we need to randomize the price that is actually used. while the blue line by miners looks actually quite good, there were no attackers during this period

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the algo is to use a deterministic random starting point within the past day. starting from that point if there are 51% of the prior days prices that are within 3% of the starting price, the correlated price is the starting price. I tried to smooth the correlated data but as we can see from the orange it isnt very smooth at all. and the green data is not any better, so I need to restart from the very raw data and see what it looks like. that is what the current version does

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I am hoping the orange becomes a lot more randomized, but the green to be somewhat smoothed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though thinking about it, the orange is actually not so bad considering the constraints it is under
